newsitem.title: BOSNIA: Karadzic's wife complains of NATO arrest in Bosnia.
newsitem.headline: Karadzic's wife complains of NATO arrest in Bosnia.

text.p: The wife of indicted war criminal Radovan Karadzic accused NATO forces on Thursday of committing a "dishonest act" when they arrested a suspect in Bosnian Serb-controlled territory.

Ljiljana Karadzic, head of the Red Cross in Bosnia's Serb territory, alleged that NATO forces had "misused" the Red Cross symbol while arresting a suspect in the northwest town of Prijedor, the Bosnian Serb news agency reported.
NATO peacekeeping troops said they arrested Milan Kovacevic, director of Prijedor hospital, and shot dead a second suspect who opened fire on British soldiers trying to arrest him.
Both men are charged by the U.N. war crimes tribunal in connection with a genocidal campaign to deport Moslems and Croats from the Prijedor region at the beginning of the 1992-95 conflict.
Mrs Karadzic alleged NATO soldiers entered the Prijedor hospital carrying a Red Cross parcel and pretending to deliver medicine.

"Respecting the symbol of the Red Cross, doctor and humanist Kovacevic received them and wished to thank them. At that moment he was arrested...," Karadzic said in a letter to the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC).
She urged the ICRC to comment on the incident.
The NATO-led peace force offered few details of the arrest operation and spokesmen were unavailable to comment on the allegations.
Karadzic's husband, former president of Bosnian Serb territory, has been indicted twice by the tribunal for his conduct of the war. He remains at large.
